website_summaries.verdict: An eco-friendly solid bamboo knife block that fits a total of 20 knives and looks great on the counter.
pros: Holds a good number of both small and large knives
Enough room to fit 8 steak knives
The block also has a spot for a pair of kitchen scissors
Angled slots so knives glide in easily
Slots are also deep enough to accommodate most knives
cons: Not enough space for storing many thinner knives since a lot of slots are fairly wide

customer_reviews.title: LEAKING SAP OR GLUE ON MY KNIVES
customer_reviews.text: So if you just have cheap crappy walmart steak knives this will probably work for you. My slightly above average steak knives barely fit into the slots. It's a nice looking block but they use pine from old pallets oozing sap for the inside. I was able to clean one but the other kept leaving residue on the knife. I almost exchanged the block but decided to return it. If they used cedar or oak for the inside would be a 4 star block.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Steak knife slots not evenly cut
customer_reviews.text: Would be a great knife block--if the steak knife slots had been cut evenly. Unfortunately, 2 slots in mine are smaller than the others, meaning the knives stop 2" short of fitting.
customer_reviews.author: lc

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst built item I have ever purchased. The knife slots were not even. Some didn't even go all the way through like they should have. The slots were so close together that the larger knives would fit because the handles hit each other. The fact that the slots were at wrong angles didn't help. Promptly returned.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Good block if you have a budget!
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing a cheap knife block I was given and will now hold all of my knives, as I have multiple knives that are just shy of 2". I only have 3 main issues with this block but for the price I know I'm not paying for quality. This will be fine for holding my knives though. 1. The edges were not sanded, there is splintering around all of the holes. 2. If you put knives next to the scissors, then they all touch and don't sit nicely. 3. This block is only bamboo on the outside. The core looks to be made from pine
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Well made and (mostly) functional
customer_reviews.text: This knife block is nearly great. It is well made, looks good, holds knives at least up to 9", the knife ports are beveled, which makes a positive difference and spacing is OK. Some reviews mention that steak knives are too close, and while they are a little tight, they remain easy enough to use. The nearly square hole might be good for a knife sharpener, however, it is not suited to holding shears due to the proximity to adjacent knives. But, I can't remember the last time I used these, so they live in a drawer now. So, this slot stays empty and because of its size is a bit awkward. Otherwise, a great knife block.
customer_reviews.author: kavaboy

customer_reviews.title: Down because of an annoying defect which doesn't affect performance
customer_reviews.text: Even if in perfect condition, this would look pretty utilitarian. But it didn't come in perfect shape: the widest slot, the one at the top of the block, has a 3/4" piece of wood split down and protruding into the hole over 1/8". This is at the edge end of our Rachel Ray 2 3/4" orange beauty, and the split isn't weight-bearing or anything like that, so we're not going to bother returning this, and I'll put up, in my saintly way, with being annoyed by seeing the split every time I look at the block; after all, this does hold all of our good knives, with a few slots left over.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value in many-slotted knife block
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a BIG block for my many kitchen knives of varying blade widths and lengths up to 11 inches. I found this is the best for the price FOR MY NEEDS. Pleased with my purchase. I always hand wash my knives and carefully place and remove knives from the block. I also keep a dishcloth over the knives to reduce airborne dust or dirt from entering the slots. When it’s time to clean, I will rinse under warm water and use a long, slim bottle-type brush is each slot. I wish it was better finished, but no serious complaints at this price, hence the four out of five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gadget®

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic knife block
customer_reviews.text: So I have the fancy expensive shun knives and I have had to keep them in the cardboard sleeves and a knife roll for more than a decade because I wasn't paying the money for a shun knife block. I saw this and realized that the measurements were massive lengthwise and should fit my very large chef's knife. Lo and behold it did and now all of my shun knives are easily in reach on the counter making cooking so much more convenient than having to drag out my knife roll. It's an attractive block as well which only makes it better.
customer_reviews.author: E. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: If you have and use alot of knives in your cooking, this is definitely a great block!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, well crafted knife block that holds all of my kitchen knives and then some! If you value the safety of the edges on your knives and keep them sharp, then using this block will help with that goal. It has room for all the longs and wides in your collection and all the shorts as well. The only way I could envision cleaning it is taking. it out in the garage and giving it a good blow out with the air compressor. Not sure I'd want to use too much water on it. Great block though!
customer_reviews.author: NotSo IdleCuriosity

customer_reviews.title: A real bargain knife block
customer_reviews.text: Has many very wide slots to accommodate butcher knives, and large chef knives. Seems well made, and though the bamboo is only a veneer it seems sturdy enough to take some abuse, eg., missing the slot opening when replacing a knife and sticking the tip into the bamboo. No problems with the fit and finish and sits level on its little rubber tip feet. I am used to previous Wusthof and Zwilling knife blocks but this one is as good if not better. The many wide slots are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Holds 9 Chef's Knives
customer_reviews.text: I basically only use chef's knives: for boning, skinning, paring, chopping, mincing, trimming fruit, slicing tomatoes, etc. The only other knife I regularly use is a very large, long, bread knife. I'm also lazy and disorganized and sometimes buy a cheap chef's knife instead of getting my knives sharpened. So I have a lot of chef's knives. Before I got this, I had two knife blocks and still couldn't store all of my knives. Now, I have one, and they all fit. And the bread knife fits too. Boom.
customer_reviews.author: BanjoGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good knife block for the money, lots of slots and good durability.
customer_reviews.text: Good knife block for the money, have owned it for a few months and have had no issues with the finish of the veneer. Seems like it should last a fairly long time. Only thing I'm not in love with is that some of the slots don't match up nicely with the knives I have but I guess thats what you get when you buy a block and knives separate instead of getting a matching set. Still this block has enough slots so I still have a slot for every knife I own. If you already have knives and just need a block, I say buy it. You won't regret it. It also looks nice on my kitchen counter top.
customer_reviews.author: low ryder

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife holder because I have mainly large knifes. It holds most of them with the exception of my Kiritsuke and Nakiri which are a little bit wider than a chef knife. It is almost perfect because the spaces for steak knives or small knives such as paring or utility, do not fit. I have several brands, and most go just half way. Overall, it is a great buy because they are no many holders that hold so many large knives, so this is in my book is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Roudemus

customer_reviews.title: The biggest & the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic purchase! Don't hesitate to buy this - it is perfect & exactly as advertised! You need all those deep cut slots because after you buy it & place your existing knives in it, you will then need to buy more 1st rate knives to fill the empty space. Don't skimp- get great knives, you'll have them for decades! This is so thoughtfully designed - it's the best of all the choices. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: PolarPro

customer_reviews.title: Best quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Enough room for all my knives, including the cleaver and the French chef's knife. Well-built. Heavy enough to avoid tipping over when filled with knives; my previous knife block did tip. The only flaw for me is that there is only one hole for a steel/sharpener; I have both. (None of the knife blocks I found anywhere would hold both a steel and a ceramic sharpener.) If this is in your price range, it's the best for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cate Francis, Author

customer_reviews.title: Everything works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger size knife block since I filled up my previous block. This one seems well made, easy to clean and holds most of my knives. I didn't really need the steak knife slots for steak knives since I don't bother with steaks at home. These slots would be more useful for me if the slots were wider. I have some ceramic knives that I would like to put in them, but they aren't wide enough.
customer_reviews.author: OldHacker

customer_reviews.title: It is damage in the bottom. See the picture pls.
customer_reviews.text: The buttom is damage when I unwraped it. The package in a big box together with my other orders. This is the only item that is damage. I send it back through USPS today.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Minas

customer_reviews.title: Wide blade knife block
customer_reviews.text: As a retired chef my collection of knives is extensive and most of them are either chef's knives or santoku both of which have wide blades. While this block is economically priced it is well made and accepts 9 wide blades including 10" knives, several narrow blades a pair of kitchen shears and a steel plus 8 paring knives it is still compact. It fits well under the counter making it convenient to use. My only criticism would be it doesn't hold a broad diamond steel plus it gets crowded with all the slots filled.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Obendorfer

customer_reviews.title: Very Adequate for this price
customer_reviews.text: Previous block I had was from Chicago Cutlery and this was a replacement for it. This is nice quality for the money. The only reason I gave it four stars rather than five is wood should have had another coat of finish or heavier, durable type applied. Finish is a light top coat and a more durable one would be very desirable. I will be applying a clear top coat so as to maintain the wood. With daily use in my busy household, the wood needs more protection than this finish provides.
customer_reviews.author: Cherri up north

customer_reviews.title: 20 slot bamboo knife holder
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it four stars because it wasn’t truly finished on the inside and the bottom had a slight crack. But for the price, I wasn’t going to send it back since it fit all my knives in there just as I had hoped. No one was going to see the crack since it was on the bottom and it doesn’t get moved . Other knife blocks only hold so many knives, but this one is really big and the slots are pretty wide, so I can fit two knives one slot, depending on size.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou

customer_reviews.title: King size knife block!
customer_reviews.text: It is too early to talk about how durable it is or how well the wood will retain its nice color but otherwise a very positive first impression. It came in a very good protective packing It has slots that would fit whatever you have, big knives, small knives, stake knives, honing steel, shears etc Sturdy and stable My only question is whether there is anything one should do so that it stays beautiful, do you need to oil it like the cutting board for instance?
customer_reviews.author: Ayman Abouseif

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, holds knives, scissors and sharpening rod
customer_reviews.text: Had to get the knives out of the drawer. This unit was large enough to take them all, yet not occupy too much space on the counter. Made of bamboo, but obviously reinforced to make it solid and cut resistant. There are eight smaller slots that can take a set of steak knives. One slot looks like it can take a small cleaver, but did not try it. Had it for a while now and it still looks brand new. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Mockingbird

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening shipping box, no damage, excellent condition, the inner product box was damaged. The top container box flap was badly torn at the tab so was very obvious the box had been previously opened and not done so carefully. Second the block was cracked in upper left corner area. Additionally the appearance of block was not accurately represented by picture on website - this is a laminated product of thin strips and looks it. The crack was along a glued lamination line - a quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Bill

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: There used to be two wooden blocks from knife sets on my mom's counter. Neither was complete, and there were random other knives in drawers and hanging inside closets because they didn't fit in the knife blocks. Now everything is in one place, easily accessible! There's even more space for more knives, just in case. The bamboo is a beautiful wood, sturdy without being too heavy, and the slots are nice and deep. Now, if only I can find the sharpening steel....I know it's around that kitchen somewhere.......
customer_reviews.author: M. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: It’s a well made knife block at a bargain price.
customer_reviews.text: This knife block is well made, a practical size and a genuine bargain. The Amazon web page for this block includes a very useful diagram that shows the width and depth of each of the block’s blade and tool slots. This will allow you to easily determine if your current knives will fit. The one caveat I have is that the rows of slots are set somewhat closely. While I was able to fit all of my Forscher/Victorinox, Gerber, and Chicago Cutlery without issue, knives with thick(er) handles may have a tight fit. All in all, I am quite pleased with this very nice block and I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Great knife block. I love the large number of wide (>=2") slots. I've filled every slot in the block, including doubling up in 2 of them. A note to the seller: THANK YOU for the diagram showing both the width and the length of each row of slots. That diagram helped immensely when I was trying to determine if most of my knives would fit. In literally hours of shopping, I did not find a single other knife block that had such a diagram including the slot length.
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Was Looking For!
customer_reviews.text: My husband & I both enjoy cooking, and we both have our favorite knives – lots of them, in many lengths and widths. In addition to the number of slots (20), I especially appreciate the width and depth of the slots. Everything from the 3-inch-wide cleaver to the 15.5-inch long chef's knife to the smallest paring knife has a space where it fits. There's a spot for the kitchen shears, too. Love having all our knives easily accessible in this attractive block!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Good value and size
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of large knives and this block is perfect. Plenty of room for everything and the price was great. The slits are slightly beveled (good!) but were a bit rough inside and there was a place by the small knives that needed to be sanded. A few minutes touched it up and some oil finished it off.
customer_reviews.author: S. Meester

customer_reviews.title: large capacity knife block
customer_reviews.text: This knife block fits a lot of knives as you can see in the picture. I have a large collection of long blade knives: chopping and bread knives for the few of us that like to work in the kitchen at the same time. This knife block fit all my knives perfectly. I only gave it 4 starts on "east to clean" because I don't think you can ever get wood perfectly clean.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived with a damaged product box, not the shipping box. It wobbled on the counter at first placement. The bamboo laminate was rough and pitted in several places. And knife slots for bottom row were obstructed with something like wood shavings or simply offset bamboo overlay. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Chewbaka

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: As a few others said, the interior slots were not sanded, so I found bit and pieces of frayed wood, mostly in the steak knife slots. So I will sand it down somehow inside. The major selling point for me was the clearly stated slot sizes, and how big they were. I have a santoku, an 8' chef, and a 10" bread knife which had to be accomodated. Next I will get a chinese cleaver so the biggest slot will get filled later on. Anybody know what the notched slot on the upper left is for?? For a sharpening rod? No explanation for that. Good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price; a bit bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particular block because some of our knives have thick handles that this block would accommodate. This worked out fine, but I was a bit surprised at the depth of the unit and how much counter space it takes up. Even so, it's a high quality block and seems like good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Freed

customer_reviews.title: Beware long steak knives on the bottom row!
customer_reviews.text: The one thing to be aware of is that the very bottom row of knife slots (for your steak knives) is shorter than the one above it--if you have longer steak knives, there is a good chance their tips will be in direct contact with your countertop, potentially dulling the blade. All in all, an attractive and very functional knife block for the price.
customer_reviews.author: I.R.M.

customer_reviews.title: It looked better and appeared better constructed than its competitors
customer_reviews.text: This knife block is just what I wanted. I had a Cutco one to go with the set of knives I bought from them; it fell apart and was appalled at the prices I found to replace it, so I looked on Amazon. This has enough slots for all the knives I have with some to spare, which are also wide enough for any knife made. It looked better and appeared better constructed than its competitors, for a very reasonable price, so I went with it. It has proven to be better looking than my old one, sturdier and more even, so I am very pleased with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Tabbycat

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful knife block with lots of spaces for varying types of knives. The only thing I would like to see different is to put the cleaver slot lower in the block, or vertical on one side. This knife seems to get in the way of my big knives (chef knives, etc.) in the slots below it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L Schmidheiser

customer_reviews.title: Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: The size was just right to hold all the knives we had in 2 knife blocks. The slots are big enough to hold all the knives we had. Plenty of room for our cleaver and scissors, along with the steel. Just make sure to keep the longest length knives to the top slots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT IS NEW AND NOT A HAND ME DOWN.
customer_reviews.text: I USED IT FOR WHAT IT WAS DESIGNED FOR. I GOT TIRED OF LOOKING IN A DRAWER FOR A KNIFE AND I AM VERY PLEASED WITH THIS PRODUCT. THE ONLY THING THAT WOULD MAKE IT BETTER IS IF IT WAS AMERICAN MADE. IT WOULD BE NICE TO HAVE A COVER FOR IT AS I USE IT AT MY CAMP SITE SO IT IS EXPOSED TO THE ELEMENTS.
customer_reviews.author: W R P

customer_reviews.title: Stores knives great
customer_reviews.text: Many reviewers have bemoaned the lack of a USB recharging port as well as the spotty Sirius XM reception it gets, but what I wanted was a block of wood to put knives in. Wood? check. Stores knives? check. 2/2 == 100% satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great, solid and better than my old block
customer_reviews.text: Great block, each slot is larger than those on most knife blocks, so no scratches on my new Wusthof knives. Appears to be well-made and solid, has a slightly lower profile and so fits nicely under my cabinets, allowing me to still pull out knives without having to slide the knife block away from the wall each time.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this block because of all the good reviews but the product I received was very disappointing and nothing like the pictures advertised. The block looked so cheap and had wood chipped everywhere. On top of that, the one I got had a huge dent on one corner. Not sure how they would even sell something defective like that. Would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: TDO

customer_reviews.title: Great knife block
customer_reviews.text: It's very well built and has plenty of spaces. The slots go all the way to the bottom so handles long knives easily. Rubber bumpers on the bottom to keep it from sliding around on counter work very well. I expect it to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: David N

customer_reviews.title: I decided to try this knife block based on the capacity and good reviews and I'm glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I had a JA Henckel knife set with the corresponding block but needed more space as my collection of kitchen cutlery expanded and considered buying a new larger Henckel knife block. However I realized I would be paying an additional $20-$30 simply for the name. I decided to try this knife block based on the capacity and good reviews and I'm glad I did. After comparing it to my old knife block I realize the quality of the construction and finish are much better than the JA Henckel block I had before.
customer_reviews.author: TimDog

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect to finally organize all my kitchen knives
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect to finally organize all my kitchen knives. Its solid and looks great in on the counter top, lots of slots for all my knives and a pair of scissors. I did wash the inside though cause when I took it out of the packaging there was dust inside of it. But I'm not going to take a star off for something so trivial.
customer_reviews.author: Gaven Gautreaux

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, but perfectly good.
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect, but perfectly good for the price. I only give it a 4 because it is a thick block of unknown wood, (pine?) covered by a thick veneer. If it were solid bamboo I'd be happier. It might not be any better and there may be reasons it's not, but I like solid better. All our knives, fork, siccors, steel and clever fit. I can fit 23 pieces in its 20 spaces.
customer_reviews.author: B Brown

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but not great nor made of all bamboo
customer_reviews.text: This is not truly made of all bamboo. It’s a block of wood covered in bamboo. The craftsmanship could be better as when you look on the inside you can see a lot of loose wood chips that come out when you put or pull your knives out. The spacing between the knives could be a little more spacious as if you have knives with even a slightly wider handle, it doesn’t hold as many knives as you would think
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds alot
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be exactly what I needed, we had acquired a few extra knives that didnt fit in our old block. I had tried a different block that held 12 instead of our old 8, but it didnt fit in our small corner behind the sink. This is super narrow for how much it holds, and I even double up a couple narrow knives in the wider slots (probably not the best, but it works for me!) So glad I found this, nice to have the steak knives out where we see and use them more too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, as I'm searching for a way to hold / organize the knives that I've been accumulating. However, the slots are too thick / wide in the top of the block, so the fit is very sloppy. The 8 lower slots are too close together (vertically) to fit 8 knives in. It wasn't going to work for my situation, so it went back. Shipped quickly though.
customer_reviews.author: E. Basch

customer_reviews.title: fine product, just be certain of your steak knife blade length
customer_reviews.text: Nice addition to my countertop to hold new Shun knives. Only drawback, and easily fixed is that my steak knives blade length caused them to hit the counter when inserted into lower tier. Fixed by glueing a thin strip to bottom of block so blades were secured
customer_reviews.author: roy a dudley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: This block is great. It was just what I wanted. My other block was so annoying as the knives had to be put back in the right slot, and it always took too much time. This way, the knives pretty much fit in most of the slots, keeping them sharp. I found I could put even more knives in it as the spaces were generous!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Terrific! Large slots will fit variety of knives. I fill the steak knife slots to keep lots of paring knives handy. I emptied my knife drawer into the block and they are now much handier and safer from clashing with each other. I love this block! (Why didn't I buy it much sooner?!?)
customer_reviews.author: sixpencedreamy

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with the construction
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the few knife blocks that could hold my entire collection of knives and not break the bank in cost. I'm happy with the construction, and haven't seen any issues in the last couple months of use. I like that the slots are cut wide enough to accommodate my 6" Santoku knives, and are long enough to hold my chef's knife and bread knife.
customer_reviews.author: KHJ

customer_reviews.title: Ridges/Steps along slots.
customer_reviews.text: Some slots have misaligned wood strips causing steps along the slots. These steps can catch the point of knife when inserted. Widest slot at top is only 3.36" wide. Steak knife slots are only .84" wide with only .43" separation between top and bottom slots. Steak knife slots have wood fibers in the slots and the bottom slots are only 4.75" deep. Using at home for kitchen knives.
customer_reviews.author: F. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: One problem
customer_reviews.text: The knife holder was just the right size and quite lovely. However, on one of the top knife slots was a 1/4 inch long parallel hole that must have been a defect. Although it was small, I know how I operate in the kitchen and I would have put the knife in that little slot instead of the intended slot -- probably so many times that I would have had both incorporated into one slot which would not have been good. So I regretfully had to send the item back.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Moss

customer_reviews.title: Lots of slots available!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has more slots for knives than our old one. We finally have all our knives out for easy access. My only complaint is the hole for the knife sharpening rod is too short to accommodate the rod we have. Seems to be pretty solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: S. Howe

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly as expected. It's a nice quality product with a much better layout than our old one. Nice wide slots accommodates knives that didn't fit before. It holds 8 steak knives instead of the more common 6. It even has a slot for my butcher knife and kitchen shears. All this extra and it takes the same amount of space as our old one.
customer_reviews.author: Dale C.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of slots in including one for a Chinese "cleaver" ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of slots in including one for a Chinese "cleaver". Some blades if very long will poke thru and touch your counter top my 10" blades will do that but 8" are ok. Price is very reasonable. Be sure and dry off any knifes before you store them because if the inside gets wet you will rust carbon steel blades.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot H.

customer_reviews.title: Knife block to fit all of your knives.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice knife block. There is ample space and it is well constructed. The slots are so close together, however, that the knives’ handles end up touching. That aspect makes it seem a little sloppy. I am happy enough with it to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen mc

customer_reviews.title: The 2" slots are tight
customer_reviews.text: You have to be careful when pulling the 2" knives out as those slots could have used a extra 1/16 - 1/8" wider so you don't scrape the blade when you pull the knife. You can be careful, put pressure on the back of the knife or twist it to gain a bit of space for the blade.
customer_reviews.author: GotAFarmYetTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. We had Kapoosh that worked fine until it got older and the plastic pieces bent and you couldn't get the knives back in. So I wanted something that would hold our mismatched knives and as a bonus holds all our steak knives too.
customer_reviews.author: fvencill

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity slot is perfect for meat cleaver size.
customer_reviews.text: I like the number of available slots to use. I wish there was an actual wood stopper bottom on it and a piece of glued-on felt on the bottom. Overall it is a good knife holder block.
customer_reviews.author: KLee

customer_reviews.title: Some things made in the USA are junk...like this.
customer_reviews.text: Poor finish & has wood chips in slots, slots too close together and too wide. Can't use all slots b/c knife handles jam together. They need to go back to the drawing board!
customer_reviews.author: cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Great knife block
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good knife block that would hold all the Cutco knives I have. Cutco would sell me a block for $450. To me, that is just crazy. Found this block. Looks great. Plenty of slots. Perfect for what I need and at less than $30 bucks! Highly recommend this knife block.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: characteristic pungent odor
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I give an item rating in one star. I can't understand why there are so many 5 stars, can't you smell the characteristic pungent odor? (formaldehyde according to my knowledge). 刺鼻性气味,和室内装修是一个味道,我认为甲醛超标,我头都被顶迷糊了,服了,我第一次给一星。
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Knife Block
customer_reviews.text: I had a knife block by Henckels and I like this one SOOO much better. The knife slots are rounded so your knives slide right in and the bamboo is such a nice, smooth finish. It fits everything I had in the old knife block but with a much smaller footprint on my counter.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Cutting edge
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace 30 year old block that was too beat up to put back in new kitchen. This one looks great and I'm sure it will last many years. The price was great for the quality. My only complaint is too many slots in the same size. Would have liked another large slot for very large chefs knife as I use the largest slot for cleaver. Next to it could be a small one for paring knife. Love having slots for steak knives. Love the bamboo.
customer_reviews.author: B B

customer_reviews.title: Five stars for sure!!!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of the reviews on this product and most were very favorable. Just for the sake of doing my research I went to pretty much all of our local retailers who sell this type of product. What I learned is that for the price, you really can't come close to this value...both in price and quality. For those that posted a negative review....well some people can just never be pleased. Maybe they prefer a pretigious brand or want to be proud of paying a high price. Well...that's not us. This is a great product, worth every penny....and more actually. Five stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: RheMark

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: This knife block replaced 2 older blocks and it is working fine. Just enough slots and looks better with only one block on the counter. Well made and heavy duty......I'm really liking it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bonnem

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I just bought a new (to us) park model camper that is almost perfect. It has all the amenities that one would want except for adequate storage for pots and pans and kitchen knives. My husband is an avid cook and likes to have his cooking utensils readily available. This knife block is the perfect size to have on the counter right next to the stove. It holds all the different sized knives including the cleaver and even our steak knives. So, needless to say, we are very happy campers! :)
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Dubord

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of knives but no where to put them. Saw this 20 knife bamboo block and decided to give it a try. So very glad I did! It's darn near perfect and I love it! No more searching for a knife; they're right at hand and ready. The block doesn't even take up much space in my small kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very solid build
customer_reviews.text: This is the highest capacity knife block we've ever owned. So far its perfect. I'm not sure how to rate ease to clean. It doesn't come apart but I wouldn't expect it to. It does feel very solid and all the storage points are clean and easy to use. For the money this is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Marc F

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice, Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This block is very nice, especially for the price. I have a lot of expensive German knives, and I gave up my high end knife block due to the limited number of wider widths for my larger knives, which this one accomodates. I'm very satisfied, except I wish the slots were narrower for everything except the cleaver slot. With the wide slots, my knives tend to hang down and slightly interfere with the knife handle below. Otherwise, I like this one a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Maxman

customer_reviews.title: Good block, close slots
customer_reviews.text: I do like this knife block, but the slots are a little close together. The construction seems solid, it doesn't skid on my counter top and the slots are suitable sizes for pretty much every knife I owned. It can be an issue if you want to fill up every slot, especially if those knives have thicker handles. I just put a knife in every other slot, otherwise the handles may bump right up next to one another which makes it harder to grab a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Need more small holes for kitchen knives. Most folks ...
customer_reviews.text: Need more small holes for kitchen knives. Most folks have only a few huge knives and more utility type.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley C.

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It's the first knife block holder I've ever purchased. It holds my steak knives and all my other knives too. Now all my knives are organized and in one place. I can always find the knife I'm looking for. It's looks beautiful sitting on my counter. I can fit more than 1 knife in most of the slots. And the price was right too!
customer_reviews.author: Grandmama 3

customer_reviews.title: Good knives so far
customer_reviews.text: Knives look great, my wife likes the sharpness and the different knives to use. Packaging could be much better as the box was not sturdy and all wrapped up in tape. I do not know if this was the manufacture or if it was inspected at the point of entry to the USA. To the manufacture's credit, they had each blade in a plastic sheath which protected the blade, that was nice. I bought a separate solid wood block to house my new knives and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits very well on the counter!!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and attractive. Openings are as shown and plenty long enough so the knife tip doesn't hit bottom. A great value!! Don't buy one of the holders with thin plastic inserts, the knives will not rest properly and you can't get them in all the way. The blade sticks out and is quite dangerous. I tossed mine after getting cut again trying to get a knife in the holder and bought this. Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D

customer_reviews.title: Great storage capacity
customer_reviews.text: Great storage!!! I can finally fit all knives in one place. Quality not as good as i would like. See some splinters inside knife slots
customer_reviews.author: Jackie2000

customer_reviews.title: Great block for an expanding collection
customer_reviews.text: The block holds all my knives, including my 2 10" chef knives (one Asian, one standard). It also has enough slots for future expansion. If you buy knives one at a time as I tend to, this is for you. Craftsmanship is impeccable.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Ockerman

customer_reviews.title: I like it because it will make cleaning the block easier ...
customer_reviews.text: The block is well made and surprisingly compact for the number of slots. The feature I was impressed with was the one slot large enough for a Chinese type cleaver. As this is the first slotted knife block I've owned (always used magnetic strips before) I don't know if the slots being open on the bottom is normal or not. I like it because it will make cleaning the block easier but at the same time, I have to be careful what knives I put into the slots so I don't nick the counter top. All in all it really has made food prep in the kitchen easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: If you have a lot of different sized knifes, this is the product for you. It holds scissors too. I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: 5 pounds and feels pretty solid.
customer_reviews.text: It's advertised as a 20 slot block but actually I have 25 knives in it. When I was younger most of these knife blocks were a dark finish. I find this look more modern looking. Filled with knives, mine weighs 9.5 pounds and feels pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: lonestarpilot

customer_reviews.title: The knives fit better, but still stick out a 1/4 inch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and a set of Dalston knives together. The steak knives wouldn't fit all the way in because the slots were cut incompletely all the way through. If you have small steak knives it would probably be ok, but not larger ones. Its a cheap knife block. Bought the Wusthof block instead. The knives fit better, but still stick out a 1/4 inch. Missed the return window, now Im stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: W J

customer_reviews.title: Accommodating for pre owned knives.
customer_reviews.text: I had several Cutco knives to get up and out of a drawer space I needed for something else. I ordered this knife block and it accommodated all my knives as well as a slot for kitchen shears. Was good for me!
customer_reviews.author: B. A. SERBA

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room for all the knives
customer_reviews.text: This butcher block takes up a bit more counter space than others, but it can hold more large knives as a result. I haven't tried cleaning it, so can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great knife holder
customer_reviews.text: This holds lots of knives. It is big and takes up space on the counter, but super nice to hold all the knives.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Gramma

customer_reviews.title: Too Big
customer_reviews.text: This knife block definitley has the space to hold all your knifes but it takes up a lot of counter space! It’s gigantic!
customer_reviews.author: Keep It Real & 100

customer_reviews.title: Nice Knife Block, but bummed my steak knives don't fit
customer_reviews.text: All around nice Knife Block/Holder. My only problem is that the width of the 8 Steak Knife slots on the lower section of the unit is a bit too narrow to fit mywhich was the reason I wanted to get a new Knife Block. Otherwise it fits my other knives. I am bummed. I could have checked, so it is my bad, but I just didn't think it would be an issue as the steak knives seemed pretty standard
customer_reviews.author: J. Kinsella

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking holder, good value
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of trepidation about this purchase but very pleasantly surprised. Very attractive, not too big a footprint on the countertop, slots work out well in terms of width and depth for a variety of knives. Study the picture to get a feeling for the capacity-- for reference, the little slots on the bottom hold steak knives. I think the value is excellent especially with the cyber deal. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Good option but notperfect.
customer_reviews.text: Some of our wider knives, including steak knives, don't fit. Otherwise it is godd and what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jen P

customer_reviews.title: I love horizontal knife blocks
customer_reviews.text: Hate vertical slotted knive blocks. I chose this for the direction and the amount of space available. Works as well as I hoped
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S Hurford

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Made
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made. Solid wood. Plenty of room so knives slide in smoothly. Heavy so it won’t slide around.
customer_reviews.author: LSands

customer_reviews.title: Don't mess with me in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed, my small cleaver has been relegated to the back of a drawer for years and forgotten about, and now has an easily accessible place in my knife block, along with the extra steak knives, the "sharp" serrated picnic knives, and that cheap set my mom sent me with some mediocre Omaha Steaks now sitting in the old knife block right next to it. As a bonus, people are now greeted with 20+ knives staring at them if they try to bother me while I'm in the kitchen. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking and Well Designed
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful thick bamboo veneer over a solid pine block. Plenty of storage, and lots of wide slots.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Style and Function - Super!
customer_reviews.text: Very sophisticated in it's looks - for this price, I'd challenge anyone to find a better block.
customer_reviews.author: Diver Joe

customer_reviews.title: Arrived cracked in 2 places; poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived cracked on top (~1 inch) and bottom (~3 inches); poor quality control. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Bapple

customer_reviews.title: Fits all my knives
customer_reviews.text: I've been collecting knives over the years from the ones I used when I started to cook for my family in my teenage years, to the ones I got when I went to college, to the ones I use now from taking home old ones from the restaurant I work at. ( I take home the old knives and get them a new edge at a local butchers I shop at.) This block fits all of them, no matter how different the knives are, there's a slot for them. Very satisfied, looks great on my counter!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McGrady-Powers

customer_reviews.title: A good looking knife stand
customer_reviews.text: I got this stand to organize my knives and to get them out of the shelves where they were in danger of bumping into other cutlery. This stand has plenty of slots and easily fits all my knives.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn Romero

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I truly enjoy my organizer. I did over estimate my number of knives so i have some empty slots, but i am not disappointed, I can now buy more knives. My cleaver even fits in a slot! It has several different size slots from cleaver size to paring knife size.
customer_reviews.author: chestercat

customer_reviews.title: Exaclty what I needed/ordered
customer_reviews.text: As my kitchen knife collection ahs grown, I outgrew our pervious knife block, and needed a larger capacity one. This fit the bill precisely!
customer_reviews.author: hgstern

customer_reviews.title: Holds more knives of all sizes than other models
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to reduce the clutter in my kitchen drawers and organize things more efficiently. This knife block emptied one entire drawer of loose knives and made them easier to reach and use when I'm cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Old Scribe

product_meta.title: 20 Slot Universal Knife Block: Shenzhen Knives Large Bamboo Wood Knife Block without Knives - Countertop Butcher Block Knife Holder and Organizer with Wide Slots for Easy Kitchen Knife Storage
feature_bullets: 20 UNIVERSAL SLOTS: Our knife blocks hold up to 19 knives with an extra slot for scissors or a sharpening rod; please note you will receive the kitchen knife block only as no knives are included. ORGANIZES & DISPLAYS: Our two tier knife holders beautifully organize and display your knife set while making the knives more accessible for cooking; they match any kitchen decor and are a great gift
WIDE ANGLED OPENINGS: The horizontal slots put less wear on the blades and are angled with a wider opening for easier handling and to fit everything from smaller steak knives to larger chef knives
DURABLE & LONG LASTING: This wooden knife block is strong and sturdy to hold heavy knife sets and is finished with a beautiful bamboo veneer that’s naturally antimicrobial and easy to wipe clean
NON SKID FOOTING: This free standing knife block is designed with four low profile anti skid rubber feet that prevent it from dangerously sliding around on your kitchen counter
Large size measures 5.25" (W) x 11" (L) x 8" (H). (THERE ARE TWO SIZES AVAILABLE FOR THE KNIFE BLOCKS: LARGE AND X-LARGE. PLEASE CHECK THE PRODUCT IMAGES FOR MEASUREMENTS PRIOR TO PURCHASING)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,337 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
